metadata.name: MB// 1
metadata.description: A motherboard is the main circuit board in a computer that connects all of the other hardware components together. It serves as a hub that allows the CPU, memory, storage, and other components to communicate with each other. The motherboard also includes various ports and slots for connecting peripherals such as a monitor, keyboard, and mouse. It also includes a variety of chips, such as the BIOS chip, which stores the system's basic input/output settings, and the chipset, which controls communication between the various components. The motherboard is a crucial component that is responsible for the overall functionality of the computer. // This is a generated Image of a Motherboard //
